titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: The North Washington Institute, located in North Washington, Pennsylvania, was organized in 1879. R. B. Gilfillan was the first principal. Other principals included R. D. Crawford and Ira Flinner. Students' religious affiliations included Presbyterian, United Presbyterian, Lutheran, Methodist Episcopal, Baptist, Reformed Presbyterian, and none. The institution's last class graduated in 1914.

scopecontent.p: This is a small collection of records related to the North Washington Institute. Materials include a student record book, 1892-1894, which lists students names, courses, and grades; and a register of students, by term, 1903-1909. The collection also contains some records of the Conaber Literary Society, including minutes, 1880-1890; a member list, 1884; and a partial constitution.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
